text: Thanks for this Luke. Panic button was hit, apologises again. I’ll use the above link for anything support in the future. Thanks fellas
I got this email also and a couple of other staff here got the same one but with different portals.
Yes. One of our clients received this email recently. I was about to reach out to HS support to learn more. Have you investigated it at all?

one of our team members did and this is what she said ..

Just got off the phone with HubSpot support. The API Development Team over there is currently meeting right now about this because a lot of partners/clients are calling in with confusion. They should be sending out another email (more than likely sometime today) going into more detail about this.

FYI I was actually the one to send that out. If you aren’t using that API intentionally you are likely fine. We figured it was best to cast a wide net in cases someone’s key was compromised. It could be anything from a script someone had that would expose their key to someone opening up the JS console and making a call one time to see what would happen.  Feel free to ping me directly if you have any questions. Happy to look up specific portals if you want
When changing the favicon in site settings, whats the ETA for that to take effect?
nvrmnnd, caching

So i noticed a minor issue in the CMS modules JS field...adding a JS function to that will automatically be minified and rewritten so the function name will not be the same when trying to call it from the HTML+HUBL section above. Putting the function in a js file and attaching it to the module does resolve this. Hope this helps someone who has a similar issue.
Anyone know how I get to those style rules?
Seem to be on the template as _HubSpot generated template builder_ but can't locate them at all
Those are usually edited from the Page Editor Styles tab which is available for default HubSpot modules (sending a screenshot).
Let me know if you aren't finding anything there for that form.

Hi <@U26AKMZ19>

Not seeing any styles in there related to what's being displayed, very odd!
Hmm, weird :thinking_face: do you mind send me a link to the page you're working on so that I can take a closer look (can send it to me over in a direct message)?
Yeah, will send it over now, thanks Jason

Hiya I had a custom module with regex display conditions on several options like such - ^((?!featured-article|recent_updates).)*$ - and suddenly they're all coming up as invalid. It won't allow me to use parentheses in this box any longer??
We are working on this right now actually, thanks for the patience
of course, no worries at all <@UGMGP7A72> :slightly_smiling_face: Just want to make sure you're getting to the right spot to get help, faster. :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U39DT5YFL> How does it look now?
It's working! :tada:
thanks for the help <@U26AKMZ19>!!:pray:
